previewArticle.title: New York Red Bulls vs. Sporting Kansas City | MLS Match Preview

recapArticle.title: New York Red Bulls 2, Sporting Kansas City 1 | MLS Match Recap

timelineItems.desc: The Red Bulls and Sporting KC are underway at Red Bull Arena.
timelineItems.title: KICKOFF: New York Red Bulls vs. Sporting Kansas City

timelineItems.comment: First Half begins.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: #NYvSKC on @LiveExtra right here: http://t.co/JpxzkpOqeq. We're underway, folks. Who scores first?

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: PENALTY TO NY! BWP is tripped up running into the box in the 10th minute. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Mike Pacific
timelineItems.text: Matt Besler has been quite ... not Besler-quality since getting the DP contract. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Tim Armstrong
timelineItems.text: Hilario(us) #NYvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New York Red Bulls 1, Sporting Kansas City 0. Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls) converts the penalty with a right footed shot.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Bradley Wright-Phillips pumps in the penalty kick

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Penalty. Not how Sporting wanted to start the night. Some dispute about where the foul happened, it seems.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: BWP converts for his 21st of the season. 1-0 NY. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: BWP gives @NewYorkRedBulls the 1-0 advantage. His 21st goal of the 2014 campaign. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Paulo Nagamura (Sporting Kansas City).
Jamison Olave (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the left side of the box misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Bradley Wright-Phillips pushes a shot wide

timelineItems.comment: Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: BWP now seven goals away from setting the all time record single-season... and I think he has at least another one in him here. #RBNY #MLS

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the left side of the box is close, but misses to the right.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Surprised no card at all. Actually, "surprised" isn't a strong enough word.

timelineItems.name: Ignorant Yank
timelineItems.text: Would love an explanation as to how the last defender taking down a guy in the box isn't any kind of card. #RBNY @NewYorkRedBulls #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: BWP picks off a Besler header, but his shot rolls wide. Bradley looks hungry tonight. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: I know there's lots of hand-wringing about Bradley's post-World Cup form, but nobody's suffered more than Besler. Different player.

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Aurélien Collin tries a through ball, but Dominic Dwyer is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Besler not having his greatest start here. Sporting KC's defense has been in shambles recently, so finger doesn't solely get pointed at him.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Lawrence Olum (Sporting Kansas City).
Roy Miller (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: AttitudeAJM
timelineItems.text: #SportingKC may easily be wearing one of the worst designed @MLS kits... and this is coming from a Metrostars fan. #RBNY #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Obligatory "Opara is sorely missed" tweet.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Igor Juliao down behind the play after clashing with Henry, as Miller earns a free kick not too far from SKC’s goal. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) left footed shot from outside the box is close, but misses the top left corner.
timelineItems.title: SHOT: Lloyd Sam whips a shot wide off the free kick

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: One from the training ground - Henry laterally pass to Sam, who volleys it cleverly, but wide. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Benny Feilhaber tries a through ball, but Dominic Dwyer is caught offside.
Attempt missed. Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) left footed shot from outside the box is close, but misses the top left corner. Assisted by Thierry Henry following a set piece situation.
Eric Alexander (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Assistant Bill Dittmar REALLY loved the “don’t flag for offside until they touch the ball” memo from FIFA, apparently. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Match ends, New York Red Bulls 2, Sporting Kansas City 1.

timelineItems.name: Upper 90 Soccer
timelineItems.text: FT: BWP's spot kick and Henry's screamer hand #RBNY a HUGE 2-1 win over #SKC. Eight games to go—the playoffs beckon #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: That's all she wrote. Huge win for @NewYorkRedBulls as @SportingKC drop their 4th straight: http://t.co/YIrNQNxC6q #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Dave Martinez
timelineItems.text: Final score! #RBNY 2-1 #SportingKC. Huge win for NY at home. Vibrant crowd. And Henry plays hero. Exactly what they needed.

timelineItems.name: Kristian Dyer
timelineItems.text: Just when I thought they were out...the Red Bulls pull me back in. Back into the playoff picture that is. RBNY 2 SKC 1 #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: That’s the first time the home team has won in a NY-KC game since 10/15/11. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.desc: A huge match in the Eastern Conference playoff race is ahead when the New York Red Bulls meet Sporting Kansas City at Red Bull Arena.
timelineItems.title: HIGHLIGHTS: New York Red Bulls vs. Sporting Kansas City | September 6, 2014

timelineItems.name: Mike Pacific
timelineItems.text: So will the #MLS DisCo suspend Besler since he didn't get any card? #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Toni (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked. Assisted by Aurélien Collin with a headed pass.
Chris Duvall (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: AttitudeAJM
timelineItems.text: Chris Duvall has been getting hammered early on in this game and the refs have ignored it. Where is the card? #RBNY #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Looks like Sporting KC are targeting rookie right back Chris Duvall, who is earning his paycheck today with some strong defense. #RBNY

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is too high.
timelineItems.title: SHOT: Dom Dwyer fires a shot over the bar

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is too high. Assisted by Paulo Nagamura with a through ball.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Dwyer gets in - no flag - but his shot bends just over the bar. Big let off. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Women United FC
timelineItems.text: Way too high by Dwyer, but a great breakaway on SKC's part. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick on the left wing.
Foul by Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Oswin
timelineItems.text: new york has come out with intensity on the defensive end. Something you dont often see #nyrb #mls #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Rosell was an interception machine, the place where opposing possessions went to die, and Sporting don't have that right now.

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Every single RBNY build-up comes down @SportingKC's right side. They haven't had an answer there since Myers' injury. That's the spot.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: I don’t have a replay in the press box, but Roy Miller seems awfully airborne when he gets fouled these days… #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: AttitudeAJM
timelineItems.text: No foul and no yellow card! This is getting incredibly ridiculous. Roy Miller could have been hurt. #RBNY #NYvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Thierry Henry (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the left side of the box misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: SHOT: Thierry Henry tries to wrap one inside the far post

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Henry with a free look at goal. Not sure if he was shooting or trying to feed BWP, but nothing comes of it. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Taylor Twellman
timelineItems.text: And that is the 2nd time, Matt Besler has gotten away with murder my goodness right now. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Lord Whiskey
timelineItems.text: Is Besler friends with the ref or something? #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Myers' positional sense prevented Collin from having to come wide and defend in space (which he's awful at). Teams are killing them there.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Thierry Henry (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the left side of the box misses to the right. Assisted by Dax McCarty with a through ball.
Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Roy Miller (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Game adjective has officially been upgraded from “chippy” to “gritty”. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Jersey Todd
timelineItems.text: #RunWithUs @NewYorkRedBulls #NyvSKC http://t.co/mEPoOYctxP

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: The penalty that led to @TheRealBWP's 21st goal: http://t.co/UeWwGjvVfM #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: AttitudeAJM
timelineItems.text: Colin just kept #SportingKC in the game. Sam was looking for Wright-Phillips. #RBNY #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Sal Cipriano
timelineItems.text: So what DOES Besler have to do to come off the field?! #Untouchable #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New York Red Bulls. Conceded by Aurélien Collin.
Péguy Luyindula (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Lawrence Olum (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: 2013 season ended Dec. 7. Then Jan. camp. Then 2014 season/WC/2014 season. Any wonder Besler and Zusi might be worn down a bit?

timelineItems.comment: Offside, New York Red Bulls. Thierry Henry tries a through ball, but Bradley Wright-Phillips is caught offside.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the center of the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Graham Zusi has his shot headed away

timelineItems.name: John Schweighardt
timelineItems.text: OK one minute in and no red cards for either goalkeeper. We're good! #NYvSKC #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Roy Miller backheel. Drink. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Shay Awosiyan
timelineItems.text: The openness of this #NYvSKC game makes it more fun to watch #MLS #NYRB #SKC #NBCSN

timelineItems.name: Oswin
timelineItems.text: Whatever Mike petke did for this match, he should keep it going . Team is attacking and defending well #nyrb #mls #NYvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the center of the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: REPLAY: Sporting has two good looks blocked away by the Red Bulls

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the center of the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Benny Feilhaber has a good look knocked away

timelineItems.name: soccersource
timelineItems.text: Both teams have had chances this half. Expect more scoring from this one #NYvSKC #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Women United FC
timelineItems.text: Kansas City, make sure to give your Gruenenbaum all the love. He deserves it! #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: Tony Bacchetta
timelineItems.text: @ThierryHenry is all over the field tonight. So much skill on the ball. He may retire and still be the beat player in @MLS #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked. Assisted by Toni.

timelineItems.name: Kristian Dyer
timelineItems.text: Defensively, Red Bulls very narrow against this 4-3-3. Henry is dropping back deep on the left side to allow Axelander to pinch in. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Jamison Olave (New York Red Bulls) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Oswin
timelineItems.text: Robles with a terrible clearance, but the defenders are playing like Possessed men . bailed him out #nyrb #mls #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Tricia
timelineItems.text: If @MLS decides what color the keeper wears, why are both NY and KC in red? Just because KC has stripes? Confused. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: What heart from Olave. Is hurt while clearing a ball, but play resumes and he leaves attacker onside but recovers and jumps in front of shot

timelineItems.comment: Delay over. They are ready to continue.
Foul by Roy Miller (New York Red Bulls).
Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick on the right wing.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Three minutes of stoppage, as SKC sets up for a tight angle free kick just outside the box. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Toni (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from a difficult angle and long range on the right is just a bit too high from a direct free kick.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the left side of the box is saved in the bottom right corner.
timelineItems.title: SAVE: Robles is able to knick away a blast by Dom Dwyer

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls).
Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Attempt saved. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the left side of the box is saved in the bottom right corner. Assisted by Benny Feilhaber with a through ball.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Luis Robles.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: SAVE ROBLES! Incredible stop to deny Dwyer on a 1-on-1. That'll be a Save of the Week nominee, for sure. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Robles. Huge. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Graham Zusi tries a through ball, but Aurélien Collin is caught offside.

timelineItems.desc: Ibrahim Sekagya (New York Red Bulls) is shown the yellow card.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Ibrahim Sekagya chops down Dom Dwyer

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).
Ibrahim Sekagya (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
First Half ends, New York Red Bulls 1, Sporting Kansas City 0.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 45+3' Sekagya shown a yellow card for kicking Dwyer's chest in attempt to clear the ball. 1-0 #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Tony Bacchetta
timelineItems.text: Only took till stoppage time to finally get a yellow card. Blind men Could have better officiated this match #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Jeremy Mikula
timelineItems.text: Sekagaya should be off too. Yes Dwyer elbowed first, but you cannot kick out like that. Both teams should be down to 10. Neither are #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Second Half begins New York Red Bulls 1, Sporting Kansas City 0.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Second half under way. Or is that second round?

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City).
Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Roy Miller (New York Red Bulls).
Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Anthony Galante
timelineItems.text: Flap, Vermes, FLAP! #TheFlappening #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Jamison Olave.
Attempt blocked. Paulo Nagamura (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the box is blocked. Assisted by Igor Julião with a cross.
Attempt blocked. Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is high and wide to the left.
timelineItems.title: SHOT: Benny Feilhaber pumps a shot over the bar

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 49' Feilhaber tries a clever chip to the on-running Collin, but there's a little too much behind it and NY has a goal kick. 1-0 #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Jamison Olave.

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New York Red Bulls 2, Sporting Kansas City 0. Thierry Henry (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from outside the box to the top right corner.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Thierry Henry cracks a bullet into the back of the net

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is high and wide to the left. Assisted by Igor Julião following a corner.

timelineItems.name: Jeremy Allegre
timelineItems.text: Olave coming up huge in this match! #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Kristian Dyer
timelineItems.text: Some very good defensive work from the Red Bulls midfield tonight. Very limited touches from Benny Feilhaber in dangerous places. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Thierry Henry just murdered everyone.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: GOLAZOOOOO! Henry with a SICK finish to the top corner. He's still got it, folks. Wow. #RBNY 2, #SKC 0. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Not late enough in the match for an Angry Benny goal, apparently.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Thierrrrrrry Henry. Stay tuned for that highlight. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New York Red Bulls 2, Sporting Kansas City 1. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) hits a left footed shot from the center of the box.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Dom Dwyer twists in a beauty

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Péguy Luyindula (New York Red Bulls).
Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sporting's biggest challenge now is not letting this turn into 3-0 within a single-digit span of minutes.

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: How do you generate that much power when the ball is physically behind you? Human beings can't do that. #NYvSKC #TitiIsAGod

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Dwyer with the quick response. Challenge met, and he ties Preki's single-season record.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: GOAL SPORTING KC! DWYER! A free kick is whipped to the left, then hit back across goal and Dwyer scissor kicks it in. 2-1, just like that.

timelineItems.comment: Chris Duvall (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Sean Johnson
timelineItems.text: GAME ON!!! #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Thierry Henry (New York Red Bulls).
Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: . @Ddwyer14 answers with an acrobatic side volley. Also very pretty. #NYvSKC #soccer #fun

timelineItems.desc: Igor Juliao (Sporting Kansas City) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Igor Juliao gets in elbow up too high

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Benny Feilhaber tries a through ball, but Dominic Dwyer is caught offside.
Roy Miller (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick on the left wing.
Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Jake
timelineItems.text: I love watching Thierry Henry fussing at refs as much as I do watching him play #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Good team defending from #RBNY early. Although that’s about all they’ve had a chance to do.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 5' Good pressure from SKC! Juliao overlaps Dovale and crosses for Naga, whose shot is blocked. Zusi nearly fired on the rebound. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: New York Red Bulls
timelineItems.text: 4: Olave, directly in front of the goal, heads away a shot from #SKC. 0-0 #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Based on how the team looked at training on Thursday and how they're lined up here, expect Henry to occupy the left flank quite a bit. #RBNY

timelineItems.desc: Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Graham Zusi trips up Chris Duvall

timelineItems.comment: Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Péguy Luyindula (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Disagree with the commentator - Luyindula's been excellent today for NY. Not perfect, but gets the ball into good spots all the time.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City).
Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Chris Duvall (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick on the right wing.
Foul by Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City).
Offside, New York Red Bulls. Ibrahim Sekagya tries a through ball, but Bradley Wright-Phillips is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Andre Sherard
timelineItems.text: the thing that makes Chris Duvall a solid player, he has pretty decent technical abilities and good ball control to get forward #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Armando comes on for Sekagya, who was stellar tonight but is suffering from an injury. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Big opportunity for Armando to prove his worth here. He hasn't played since making a last-minute cameo on July 4, a stretch of eight games.

timelineItems.name: Kristian Dyer
timelineItems.text: Exactly what this match needs, the calming and surreal presence of the mercurial Armando. Said no one. Ever. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: George H. Weston
timelineItems.text: Announcers for the #NYvSKC game are like heel WWF announces from the 80s in how they treat #SportingKC as evil & NY as heroes

timelineItems.name: Fútbol MLS
timelineItems.text: VIDEO | Todos sabemos que @ThierryHenry es un maestro, pero él quiere que lo recordemos cada fin de semana: http://t.co/AvfylNoFFe #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New York Red Bulls. Conceded by Matt Besler.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: A calm and surreally pinpoint pass from Armando finds Peguy and starts an attack that earns NY a corner. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: Fútbol MLS
timelineItems.text: VIDEO | Todos sabemos que @ThierryHenry es un maestro, pero él quiere que lo recordemos cada fin de semana: http://t.co/ONQ9x9igyn #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 6' Positive start from the @MLS champions, who look sharp in possession and movement. 0-0 #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is high and wide to the right. Assisted by Aurélien Collin.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Dax McCarty.
Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Matt Binder
timelineItems.text: We are playing like we don't suck! #RBNY #NYvSKC

timelineItems.desc: New York Red Bulls almost catch a break on a ball headed out by Seth Sinovic.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Seth Sinovic heads a dangerous ball out for a corner

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from more than 35 yards is high and wide to the left. Assisted by Jorge Claros.
Corner,  New York Red Bulls. Conceded by Seth Sinovic.
Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Jamison Olave (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Nearly an own goal from SKC there. Would’ve been the first of the year for NY. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: OptaJack
timelineItems.text: 3 - @SportingKC have not lost on the road against New York in their last three attempts in #MLS play (2W 1D). Hope. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Goalmouth Scramble
timelineItems.text: At Red Bull Arena to watch the great man Thierry Henry play. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: .@SportingKC has notched 3 straight clean sheets at Red Bull Arena and currently holds a 338-min. shutout streak at the stadium. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Caperna
timelineItems.text: seats are filling up fast. where's @Tim_Cahill though? #NYvSKC http://t.co/qsEpmjpVd9

timelineItems.name: Alex DeJong
timelineItems.text: #NYvSKC http://t.co/Z9ff2Yn3hy

timelineItems.name: newyorkredbulls
timelineItems.text: Pre-match #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: NY without Tim Cahill (Australia), Ambroise Oyongo (Cameroon), Matt Miazga (US U20) & Santiago Castano (U.S. U-20) due to intl. duty #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Reporting KC
timelineItems.text: Anybody else feeling pretty good about the death of a losing streak? #NYvSKC #IBelieveThatWeWillWin

timelineItems.desc: Benny Feilhaber (SKC) takes a shot from the top of the box.
timelineItems.title: BLOCK: Benny Feilhaber has a shot deflected out

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: .@TheRealBWP and @ThierryHenry have combined for 19 goals in 11 games at Red Bull Arena during the 2014 regular season. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: OptaJack
timelineItems.text: 338 - SKC have not conceded a goal in Red Bull Arena in 338 minutes of #MLS play against the Red Bulls. Clamp. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: New York Red Bulls
timelineItems.text: Pre-match #NYvSKC #RunWithUs http://t.co/bQrQ7Aciy6

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: .@TheRealBWP leads the Golden Boot race with 20 goals. He needs 7 more in his last 9 games to tie the @MLS single season record. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: BW
timelineItems.text: Need 3pts tonight from @SportingKC It's time to start a winning streak! #NYvSKC @NBCSportsSoccer

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Tonight’s match is the start of the brutal stretch of 7 games in 22 days for #RBNY. Immense gut check is ahead.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: U.S. international @gzusi and World Cup winner @ThierryHenry are tied for sixth in @MLS with 61 chances created. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Upper 90 Soccer
timelineItems.text: As long as the rain holds off, we're all set for a perfect night at Red Bull Arena #RBNY #NYvSKC https://t.co/g9TyCloe45

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Sal Zizzo.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Jamison Olave.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: NY fans thankfully it’s 2013 Olave out there and not 2014 Olave. Lost count of how many blocks he has tonight. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.name: newyorkredbulls
timelineItems.text: @mrlloydsam x 4 #NYvSKC #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Peter Galindo
timelineItems.text: McCarty & Alexander will be crucial in this #NYvSKC match. Midfield battle will be the difference. Or SKC's leaky defence.

timelineItems.name: Cass
timelineItems.text: Pre-match festivities are in full swing here at RBA. #NYvSKC @NewYorkRedBulls http://t.co/0qWrgh8wHs

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Saer Sene.
Attempt missed. Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) header from the left side of the box is close, but misses to the left. Assisted by Matt Besler following a corner.

timelineItems.name: reneereynolds
timelineItems.text: I see your #USOpen and I raise you #NYvSKC @NewYorkRedBulls

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: SKC’s Antonio Douvale apparently just goes by “Toni”. Vermes must look for a Tony and a Toné in the next window. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Lineups are announced and players are warming up.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Didn't have a good feeling about #RBNY's chances to win this one coming in, but Luyindula will be key. I'm picking Red Bulls, 3-2.

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Chris Duvall.

timelineItems.desc: Penalty New York Red Bulls. Bradley Wright-Phillips draws a foul in the penalty area.
timelineItems.title: PENALTY: Matt Besler trips up Bradley Wright-Phillips in the box

timelineItems.desc: Penalty New York Red Bulls. Bradley Wright-Phillips draws a foul in the penalty area.
timelineItems.title: REPLAY: Penalty on Matt Besler gives the Red Bulls an early PK

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Sekagya left game with a left ankle injury. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Tonight’s announced attendance: 20831. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Jorge Claros (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is high and wide to the right.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Eric Alexander.

timelineItems.name: Christian Araos
timelineItems.text: If #SportingKC score one, they are a good bet to score two. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Margie Schmille
timelineItems.text: Besler looks as tired and done-in as I've ever seen him. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City).
Dax McCarty (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City) header from the center of the box is too high.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Seth Sinovic pops a header over the bar

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: HIGHLIGHT: @Ddwyer14 pulls one back. Can @SportingKC find a second with less than 10 to play? Watch: http://t.co/Ys0sIzdk8y #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box is too high. Assisted by Jorge Claros with a through ball.

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Chris Duvall's defensive recognition is good. Never going to be an attacking force, but he's got a good future for RBNY.

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Heard people talk in the past that Lloyd Sam doesn’t do defensive duty. He’s clearly put in the work tonight. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Sal Zizzo tries a through ball, but Igor Julião is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Sporting KC pressing high and that's causing #RBNY all sorts of problems. New York can't keep possession right now. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Penalty conceded by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City) after a foul in the penalty area.
Penalty New York Red Bulls. Bradley Wright-Phillips draws a foul in the penalty area.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 8' Collin with a crucial headed clearance to prevent a long ball over the top from reaching Bradley Wright-Phillips. 0-0 #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New York Red Bulls. Conceded by Aurélien Collin.
Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Ruben Bover Izquierdo (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Dave Martinez
timelineItems.text: Five reg season home games remain for #RBNY fans to see Thierry Henry in action. You don't know what tomorrow holds. Don't chance it. #MLS

timelineItems.name: Taylor Twellman
timelineItems.text: Dax McCarty kills BWP with that pass after doing soooo much work to get there in that spot. #NYvSKC

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Time for @SportingKC to hit right on the D-pad twice. #UltraAttacking #NYvSKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Chris Duvall.
Attempt blocked. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: Justin E. Brightbill
timelineItems.text: That's two HORRIBLE punches from Robles tonight. #rbny

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: SKC keep pushing but they looked absolutely gassed. And NY, for once, looks strong enough mentally to hold on. #RBNY #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Jorge Claros (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls).
Second Half ends, New York Red Bulls 2, Sporting Kansas City 1.
